DataElement.preferredName: Patient Observation Or Single Cycle Low Or Intermediate Risk Neuroblastoma Treatment Regimen Chemotherapy Eligibility Determination
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Eligibility information regarding a person who is under active surveillance but not given treatment unless there are changes in test results or given single cycle of chemotherapy per low or intermediate risk neuroblastoma treatment regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Observation Or Single Cycle Low Or Intermediate Risk Neuroblastoma Treatment Regimen Chemotherapy Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Closely watching a patient's condition but not giving treatment unless there are changes in test results. Active surveillance avoids problems that may be caused by treatments such as radiation or surgery. It is used to find early signs that the condition is getting worse. During active surveillance, patients will be given certain exams and tests done on a regular schedule. It is sometimes used in prostate cancer._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else._An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence._A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is moderate._A neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Patient Observation Or Single Cycle Low Or Intermediate Risk Neuroblastoma Treatment Regimen Chemotherapy Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Closely watching a patient's condition but not giving treatment unless there are changes in test results. Active surveillance avoids problems that may be caused by treatments such as radiation or surgery. It is used to find early signs that the condition is getting worse. During active surveillance, patients will be given certain exams and tests done on a regular schedule. It is sometimes used in prostate cancer.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.:An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.:A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is moderate.:A neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Closely watching a patient's condition but not giving treatment unless there are changes in test results. Active surveillance avoids problems that may be caused by treatments such as radiation or surgery. It is used to find early signs that the condition is getting worse. During active surveillance, patients will be given certain exams and tests done on a regular schedule. It is sometimes used in prostate cancer.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.
A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is moderate.
A malignant neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was patient observed or treat
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was patient observed or treated with a single cycle of chemotherapy per a low or intermediate risk neuroblastoma regimen (e.g. as per ANBL0531, ANBL1232 or similar) for what initially appeared to be non-high risk disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If No, Was patient observed or treated with a single cycle of chemotherapy per a low or intermediate risk neuroblastoma regimen (e.g. as per ANBL0531, ANBL1232 or similar) for what initially appeared to be non-high risk disease?
